roadmap_data.summary: A rigorously sequenced curriculum that transforms a novice into an employable backend engineer capable of designing, implementing, deploying and maintaining horizontally-scalable RESTful services. Emphasis is placed on deterministic API contracts, ACID data integrity, automated quality gates, and cloud-native observability.

stages.title: Computer Science & Network Primitives
stages.description: Acquire the substrate knowledge required to reason about everything that happens after the TCP handshake. Master POSIX process model, I/O syscalls, HTTP semantics, and the event loop to understand why backend runtimes behave the way they do.
learning_objectives: Differentiate blocking vs non-blocking I/O
Explain TCP three-way handshake and TLS 1.3 negotiation
Describe virtual memory, paging, and their impact on GC pauses
Interpret HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2 frame layouts
Use strace/tcpdump to verify syscall and packet flow
stages.project_idea: Build a minimal C10K-capable echo server in C using epoll/kqueue and benchmark with wrk.

quiz.question: Which syscall is used to monitor multiple file descriptors for readiness?
What is the default TCP port for HTTPS?
Which HTTP method is idempotent but may return different status codes on retry?
In HTTP/2, what mechanism prevents head-of-line blocking?

stages.title: Type-Safe Language Core & Toolchain
stages.description: Develop fluency in a statically-typed backend language (Java 21+ or Go 1.22+) covering generics, memory model, concurrency primitives, and the official toolchain. This stage establishes deterministic build pipelines and unit-testing hygiene.
learning_objectives: Model domain entities with value objects and aggregates
Leverage virtual threads (Project Loom) or goroutines for concurrency
Write table-driven unit tests with 100 % statement coverage
Package reproducible artifacts with Maven/Go modules
Analyze GC logs and tune for sub-100 ms pause targets
stages.project_idea: Create a CLI ticket-booking engine with an in-memory H2/embedded SQLite store and 5000 concurrent integration tests.

quiz.question: Which Go keyword yields CPU control without blocking an OS thread?
In Java, which GC algorithm targets low-latency heaps < 32 GB?
What is the correct way to version a Go module using semantic import path?
Which JUnit 5 extension enables parameterized tests?

stages.title: Relational Data Modeling & ACID Transactions
stages.description: Design normalized schemas that enforce referential integrity under concurrent load. Master isolation levels, index internals, and query planning to guarantee consistent reads and writes at scale.
learning_objectives: Produce 3NF schemas avoiding update anomalies
Interpret B-tree and LSM-tree index structures
Choose correct isolation level to prevent phantom reads
Optimize queries using EXPLAIN ANALYZE hints
Implement pessimistic and optimistic locking patterns
stages.project_idea: Build a bank ledger microservice with PostgreSQL that passes Jepsen-style linearizability tests under 1000 TPS.

quiz.question: Which isolation level eliminates phantom reads?
What PostgreSQL feature provides MVCC snapshots?
Which index type best supports range queries on timestamp columns?
What anomaly is possible under Repeatable Read but not Serializable?

stages.title: RESTful API Design & Spring Boot / Gin
stages.description: Architect pragmatic REST endpoints adhering to Richardson Maturity Model level-3 (HATEOAS). Integrate OpenAPI-driven contracts, centralized exception handling, and DTO mapping to achieve consumer-agnostic services.
learning_objectives: Model resources with nouns and represent state via verbs
Generate OpenAPI 3.1 spec from annotations
Implement idempotent POST using the Idempotency-Key header
Version APIs via Accept header negotiation
Secure endpoints with OAuth2 resource-server JWT validation
stages.project_idea: Develop a HATEOAS-compliant catalog API with ETags, hypermedia controls, and Java SpringDoc/Gin-Swagger auto-generated SDK.

quiz.question: Which HTTP status code indicates that a resource was created?
What header is used for optimistic concurrency control?
Which annotation exposes a Spring Boot endpoint as REST?
In OpenAPI 3, where are query parameters defined?

stages.title: Testing Pyramid & Continuous Integration
stages.description: Establish deterministic quality gates: unit, integration, contract, and mutation tests. Wire pipelines with GitHub Actions/GitLab CI that enforce 80 % mutation coverage and sub-second feedback loops.
learning_objectives: Differentiate between mocks, stubs, and fakes
Write Testcontainers-based integration tests
Verify consumer-driven contracts with Pact
Configure parallel test execution to minimize wall-clock time
Gate merges on SonarQube quality profiles
stages.project_idea: Configure a polyglot repo where Spring and Go services share Pact contracts and run 10k tests in < 5 min on CI.

quiz.question: Which tool performs consumer-driven contract testing?
What does the @MockBean annotation do in Spring tests?
Which CI feature allows matrix builds across language versions?
What mutation testing metric indicates killed mutants?

stages.title: Containerization & Kubernetes Orchestration
stages.description: Package services as distroless images achieving < 50 MB attack surface. Deploy to Kubernetes with declarative manifests, readiness/liveness probes, and horizontal pod autoscaling based on 95th-percentile latency.
learning_objectives: Write multi-stage Dockerfiles with build-cache optimization
Define Deployments, Services, and Ingress resources
Configure resource requests/limits for QoS guarantees
Implement graceful shutdown with preStop hooks
Observe workloads via Prometheus service monitors
stages.project_idea: Deploy the previous catalog API to k3s with Helm, autoscale from 1 to 20 pods under 30 % CPU, and maintain p99 < 200 ms.

quiz.question: Which probe determines when a pod receives traffic?
What Kubernetes object manages desired replica count?
Which annotation triggers nginx-ingress rewrite?
What is the default imagePullPolicy if tag is latest?

stages.title: Observability, SRE & Production Hardening
stages.description: Instrument code with OpenTelemetry to emit traces, metrics, logs. Define SLOs with 99.9 % availability, error budgets, and automated rollback via GitOps to achieve production resilience.
learning_objectives: Correlate traces with logs using TraceId
Define RED metrics for every endpoint
Create Prometheus recording rules for SLI calculation
Implement circuit-breaker with resilience4j or go-resiliency
Conduct chaos experiments with ChaosMesh
stages.project_idea: Run a game-day exercise: inject 2s latency between catalog and payment pods, verify alert fires, and auto-scale resolves SLO breach.

quiz.question: Which OpenTelemetry signal provides request-scoped data?
What does the 'E' stand for in RED metrics?
Which Kubernetes object is ideal for chaos experiments injecting pod-kill?
What is the recommended error budget burn rate alert window?
